Description: Fragment of pottery domed lid (?) with small horizontal strap handle. White slip outside, interior reserved. On dome, forepart of a goat browsing to right; in field, mixed geometric patterns. On rim metopal frieze with maeander crosses and 'ladders'; strap handle decorated with key meander band.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 218, no. 58)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 110, pl. XXXIV, no. 321.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.19)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4680 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
